thread.title: Comment on Plenty of Kentucky in Top 100 College Basketball Players by Luther
thread.title_full: Comment on Plenty of Kentucky in Top 100 College Basketball Players by Luther

author: Luther
title: Comment on Plenty of Kentucky in Top 100 College Basketball Players by Luther
text:
CBSSports.com came out with their top 101 players in college basketball this season and to the surprise of no one Kentucky is well represented on the list. They explain the list isn’t made for MVP’s, overall value to a team or how one might look at All-Americans, but rather you’re playing a game of pickup and want to pick the best players. 
Jamal Murray led the way for the Wildcats at No. 5 as Skal was right behind him at No. 6. In an ironic fashion Kyle Wiltjer came in at No. 4, just goes to show you how good Cal is at finding talent. Also on the list were Tyler Ulis at No. 33 and Alex Poythress at No. 87. North Carolina, Kansas, Maryland and Duke also had four players on the list. 
Kris Dunn was voted No. 1 by the staff. Now, I know he’s not on the list now but at the end of the season don’t be surprised to see Isaiah Briscoe on this list. Thoughts? Complaints? Let me hear them. Article written by Bobby Reagan One time representative of UK at SEC 3v3 basketball championships. Northern Yankee living the Kentucky dream. Follow me @uklefty22 3 responses to “Plenty of Kentucky in Top 100 College Basketball Players” Matt/Tyler/Drew October 12, 2015 at 5:15 pm | Permalink | Reply 
do an article comparing this team to our 2012 national championship team, compare player by player, experience, skill and who willl need to step up to fully challenge that team. that would be an interesting post right before BBM. i honestly think the teams are very much a like , they just had overall better skill but we got more depth this year HackRichards October 12, 2015 at 5:25 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Best I remember Wiltzer picked us…and Cal was surprised when he heard about it…. Luther October 12, 2015 at 5:43 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Isaiah Briscoe should be on this list now… Post Comment - New and Improved (not really, it just works now)
